briefdescription.para: Creates the buffer with the specified buffer type.

detaileddescription.para: You should not usually use this directly. Instead, use a subclass which has extra functions for the buffer type.
For example, instead of creating a Buffer with the type of GL_ARRAY_BUFFER, use the VertexBuffer class.

simplesect.para: This should only be used internally or by advanced users. Misuse can cause undefined behavior

parameterdescription.para: OpenGL symbolic constant with the desired type.

briefdescription.para: Queries OpenGL whether this Object's ID is a valid object.

simplesect.para: Whether this Object represents memory
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Calls the corresponding glCreate* function and assigns an ID.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

simplesect.para: Object::unbind const

briefdescription.para: Calls the corresponding glDestroy* function and deletes the ID.

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

simplesect.para: Object::unbind const

parameterdescription.para: If this Object has not been created yet (Object::init() has not been called)

memberdef.argsstring: (const ptrdiff_t &dataSize, const void *data, const Enum drawType=GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW)
memberdef.name: setData

briefdescription.para: Creates and initalizes the data store for this Buffer

parameterdescription.para: Size of the buffer, measured in bytes.
Pointer to the actual data. Using nullptr or NULL will create an empty buffer.
Expected usage pattern for the data. GL_DYNAMIC_DRAW by default

simplesect.para: Buffer::setDataRange(const Index, const ptrdiff_t, const void*)

para.ref: Buffer::copyData(Buffer&, const ptrdiff_t&, const Index, const Index)

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

memberdef.argsstring: (const Index offset, const ptrdiff_t &dataSize, const void *data)
memberdef.name: setDataRange

briefdescription.para: Sets data in a range of the buffer.

detaileddescription.para:
Does not initialize data. Buffer:setData(const ptrdiff_t&, const void*, const Enum) must be called first.
offset
Offset into the buffer to set the data, measured in bytes
dataSize
How large the region being inserted is, measured in bytes
data
Pointer to the data being inserted
https://www.opengl.org/wiki/GLAPI/glBufferSubData

This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.
GL_INVALID_OPERATION
If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

memberdef.argsstring: (Buffer &other, const ptrdiff_t &size, const Index readOffset=0, const Index writeOffset=0)
memberdef.name: copyData

briefdescription.para: Copy part of the data store of this Buffer into another Buffer

parameterdescription.para: Target Buffer to copy into
How much data to copy
How much data to offset by in this Buffer
Where to write the data in the target Buffer

para.ref: Buffer::setData(const ptrdiff_t&, const void*, const Enum)

simplesect.para: This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Maps the data in this Buffer to a pointer on the CPU side.

parameterdescription.para: Which access to use. Must be GL_READ_ONLY, GL_WRITE_ONLY, or GL_READ_WRITE.

para.ref: Buffer::mapRange(const Index, const Size, const unsigned int)

simplesect.para: DO NOT DELETE THE POINTER RETURNED. IT IS NOT DYNAMICALLY ALLOCATED.
After Buffer::unmap() is called, the pointer returned may be unsafe. Using it will be undefined.
When using this function don't forget to use Buffer::unmap() when you are done using the pointer
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

memberdef.argsstring: (const Index offset, const Size length, const unsigned int access)
memberdef.name: mapRange

briefdescription.para: Maps a range of data in this Buffer to a pointer on the CPU side.

parameterdescription.para: The starting offset to map
How much data to map
A combination of access flags to determine how the data will be used. These flags determine how fast or slow the mapping will take.

simplesect.para: DO NOT DELETE THE POINTER RETURNED. IT IS NOT DYNAMICALLY ALLOCATED.
After Buffer::unmap() is called, the pointer returned may be unsafe. Using it will be undefined.
When using this function don't forget to use Buffer::unmap() when you are done using the pointer
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Unmaps the buffer.

detaileddescription.para: Any mapped points will be deleted and using them will be undefined.

simplesect.para: Whether the data was corrupted during reading. This will be very rare but when it does happen you must reinitialize the data.

para.ref: Buffer::mapRange(const Index, const Size, const unsigned int)

simplesect.para: Using a pointer after it was unmapped will be undefined
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Unbinds this Object which is equivalent to binding ID 0.

parameterdescription.para: If the current thread does not have an OpenGL context

briefdescription.para: Retrieves the current ID that this Object represents.

detaileddescription.para: The ID is an unsigned number that acts like a pointer to OpenGL memory. It is assigned when Object::init() is called.
If it is 0, the Object is considered uncreated.

When using Object::bind() const it will bind to this ID. Object::unbind() const will bind to ID 0, which is the equivelant of a null pointer.
The ID represented by this Object

briefdescription.para: Compares if 2 Objects are equal.

simplesect.para: Whether this and other are the same

parameterdescription.para: What to compare with

briefdescription.para: Compares if 2 Objects are not equal.

simplesect.para: Whether this and other are different

parameterdescription.para: What to compare with

briefdescription.para: Intended to be overloaded to bind to a certain index.

detaileddescription.para:
Object::bind() const and Object::unbind() const both use this function.
id
Index to bind to. If it is 0, it needs to be unbinded.
This uses an OpenGL function and must be called in a thread with an OpenGL context. Otherwise, an error will be thrown.

This should only be used internally or by advanced users. Misuse can cause undefined behavior

briefdescription.para: The ID of this `Object.

detaileddescription.para: ` Should be set in Object::init() and become 0 in Object::destroy()

briefdescription.para: Represents a buffer of memory in the GPU.

detaileddescription.para: This class should not be used directly. Instead, use special subclasses which provide additional functionality for the specific buffer type.
